page.title: 03ATTITUDES IN TYSOE - 1
page.content: The general attitude of people living in Tysoe in 1985 seems to focus on awareness of our society as being materialistic, reflected in factors such as wishing to be better off, to acquire more possessions, with self coming before the community. There is also a tendency to live for the present without due regard for the future, believing that the future is something which those living in the present need make no preparation for. However, the fact that there is concern both over the high level of unemployment which exists now and over the threat of nuclear war, suggests that the 'living for today' attitude is not totally prevalent. There is a belief that the future to some extent depends on actions of the present.
